thread.title: John Kelly: Deportation not priority for Dreamers

title: John Kelly: Deportation not priority for Dreamers
text:
The White House chief of staff said "dreamers" would not be a priority for deportation, even if their Obama-era protections expire and a deadlocked Congress hasn't completed a deal to protect them.
John Kelly told reporters at the Capitol that as long as an immigrant in the U.S. illegally has no criminal record, they are likely to stay "out of anyone's scope" for a long time. He says, "They are not a priority for deportation."
Kelly says he believes President Donald Trump wouldn't extend protections for "dreamers" beyond March 5 because he doesn't think the president has the legal authority to prolong it.
He also says Trump won't ask Congress for a short-term extension of that program. Kelly said of lawmakers: "What makes them act is pressure."
